SEARCH
Package com.example.myapplication.features.user.home

Class UHomeController

java.lang.Object
com.example.myapplication.features.user.home.UHomeController
public class UHomeController extends Object
Controller for the user home screen. Coordinates data loading and filtering.

  • Constructor Details

    • UHomeController

      public UHomeController(FirebaseEventRepository repository, com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseAuth auth, UHomeModel model, UHomeView view)
      Constructs a UHomeController with the specified dependencies.
      Parameters:
      repository - The Firebase repository for event data operations.
      auth - The Firebase authentication instance for user management.
      model - The model that holds event data and filter state for this screen.
      view - The view interface for displaying user home screen content.

  • Method Details

    • detachView

      public void detachView()
      Clears the attached view reference to avoid using a dead Fragment.

    • loadEvents

      public void loadEvents()
      Initiates loading of all events and applies the current filters. Fetches events from the repository, filters them for display based on the current user, and updates the view with the filtered results.

    • onSearchQueryChanged

      public void onSearchQueryChanged(@Nullable String query)
      Updates the stored search query and reapplies filters. Refreshes the view to display events matching the new search criteria.
      Parameters:
      query - The new search query, or null to clear the search.

    • updateInterests

      public void updateInterests(List<String> interests)
      Updates the selected interests and reapplies filters. Refreshes the view to display only events matching the selected interests.
      Parameters:
      interests - The list of interest tags to filter by.

    • updateAvailability

      public void updateAvailability(@Nullable Long startMillis, @Nullable Long endMillis)
      Updates the availability range and reapplies filters. Refreshes the view to display only events within the specified time range.
      Parameters:
      startMillis - The start of the availability range in milliseconds since epoch, or null.
      endMillis - The end of the availability range in milliseconds since epoch, or null.

    • clearAvailability

      public void clearAvailability()
      Clears the availability range and reapplies filters. Removes any time-based filtering and refreshes the view.

    • getSelectedInterests

      public List<String> getSelectedInterests()
      Returns the currently selected interest filters.
      Returns:
      A list of selected interest tags.

    • getAvailabilityStartMillis

      @Nullable public Long getAvailabilityStartMillis()
      Returns the start of the current availability filter range.
      Returns:
      The start time in milliseconds since epoch, or null if not set.

    • getAvailabilityEndMillis

      @Nullable public Long getAvailabilityEndMillis()
      Returns the end of the current availability filter range.
      Returns:
      The end time in milliseconds since epoch, or null if not set.

    • hasAvailabilityFilter

      public boolean hasAvailabilityFilter()
      Checks whether an availability filter is currently active.
      Returns:
      True if both start and end times are set, false otherwise.
